title: Provide better help when attributes on arguments are misapplied

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Inspired by part of https://kevinlynagh.com/rust-zig/. Given the following code: https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=14adf6790421ba8cc9d55b3c3685a404

```rust
pub fn read_keys(port: #[cfg(feature = "u32")]
                   u32
                   #[cfg(feature = "u64")]
                   u64) { }
```

The current output is:

```
error: attributes cannot be applied to a function parameter's type
 --> src/lib.rs:1:24
  |
1 | pub fn read_keys(port: #[cfg(feature = "u32")]
  |                        ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ attributes are not allowed here

error: expected one of `:`, `@`, or `|`, found `)`
 --> src/lib.rs:4:23
  |
4 |                    u64) { }
  |                       ^ expected one of `:`, `@`, or `|`
  |
  = note: anonymous parameters are removed in the 2018 edition (see RFC 1685)
help: if this is a parameter name, give it a type
  |
4 |                    u64: TypeName) { }
  |                    ^^^^^^^^^^^^^
help: if this is a type, explicitly ignore the parameter name
  |
4 |                    _: u64) { }
  |                    ^^^^^^

error: expected one of `!`, `(`, `)`, `+`, `,`, `::`, or `<`, found `#`
 --> src/lib.rs:3:20
  |
2 |                    u32
  |                       -
  |                       |
  |                       expected one of 7 possible tokens
  |                       help: missing `,`
3 |                    #[cfg(feature = "u64")]
  |                    ^ unexpected token

error: aborting due to 3 previous errors
```

It would be great if the first error suggested placing the attribute in the correct spot. 

```
error: attributes cannot be applied to a function parameter's type
 --> src/lib.rs:1:24
  |
1 | pub fn read_keys(port: #[cfg(feature = "u32")]
  |                  ------^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ 
  |                  |     |
  |                  |     | attributes are not allowed here
  |                  help: move the attribute to the parameter name: `#[cfg(feature = "u32")] port: u32`

```
